sub_topic: Calculating the volume of a rectangular pyramid.
message_1: A rectangular pyramid has a base with a length of 10 cm and a width of 6 cm. The height of the pyramid is 12 cm. Find the volume of the pyramid in cubic centimeters.
message_2:
To find the volume of a rectangular pyramid, we can use the formula:

Volume = (1/3) * Base Area * Height

The base area of the rectangular pyramid can be found by multiplying the length and width of the base:

Base Area = Length * Width
Base Area = 10 cm * 6 cm
Base Area = 60 cm²

Now, we can plug the base area and height into the volume formula:

Volume = (1/3) * 60 cm² * 12 cm
Volume = (1/3) * 720 cm³
Volume = 240 cm³

The volume of the rectangular pyramid is 240 cubic centimeters.
